headline: Christmas Brunch Casserole
description: This Christmas breakfast casserole with hash browns is made the night before and baked the next morning for an early morning meal or a tasty brunch.

video.description: This hearty casserole is a hit at the holidays, or any time.
video.name: Christmas Brunch Casserole

name: Christmas Brunch Casserole
recipeIngredient: 4 cups frozen hash brown potatoes, thawed

recipeInstructions.text: Cook bacon in a large skillet over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned, about 10 minutes. Transfer bacon to a paper towel-lined plate and crumble when cool enough to handle. Drain grease from the skillet.
Cook onions and mushrooms in the residual grease in the skillet until onions are translucent and mushrooms are tender, about 5 minutes.

Grease a 9x13-inch casserole dish with 1 tablespoon of butter. Place potatoes into the bottom of the dish; sprinkle with salt, pepper, and garlic salt. Top with crumbled bacon, then add onions and mushrooms.
Whisk milk, eggs, and parsley together in a mixing bowl; pour over casserole and top with Cheddar. Cover and refrigerate, 8 hours to overnight.
When ready to bake, preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Bake in the preheated oven until set, about 1 hour.

review.reviewBody: A lot of breakfast casseroles end up being really heavy or soggy with cheese sauce, egg mixture, and/or grease, but this one was not heavy at all - quite light. Only adjustments I made: I added cut-up pieces of cooked breakfast sausage links in addition to the cooked bacon, (I cook bacon in the oven though, not a pan,) I doubled the amount of cheese, and served it with sour cream on the side as well - was pretty good. Like I said, we didn’t feel “gross” after eating this for breakfast on Christmas morning :) I will make it again, but probably with two more eggs, add some extra cheese into the hashbrowns, and will cover it while it bakes for at least the first 30 mins.

I hope people read the reviews before making this because it has major potential but a few flaws. First off, don’t make a mess sautéing bacon. Do it on a rack on a sheet pan in the oven. Sauté veg in butter and olive oil, for much longer than 5 mins. You want the pan to be almost dry. Cook the water content from the onions and mushrooms and season them with salt, pepper and Italian seasoning. Definitely use 6 eggs, like others suggested here. And use way more than a cup of cheese, adding with 20 mins left to cook. If you put it on from the beginning, it forms a layer of crunchy cheese and doesn’t stay on. Also, at 400 this only needed about 35 mins in the oven to set up. I made it and baked it immediately. Increased cooking time would be needed if baked from the fridge
Waited until the last minute and couldn’t find hash browns, so I used potatoes O’Brien instead. Worked out perfectly. So yummy!
I used 8 eggs, one can of evaporated milk, and a cup of sour cream. Baked at 400 degrees F covered for 45 and took foil off for the last 15 minutes. Voila xo

I made this delicious casserole for Christmas brunch. We loved it! I baked the bacon in the oven while I was preparing the other ingredients. Used 6 eggs. No mushrooms. Added red pepper. Used more cheese than it called for. Mixed everything together and sprinkled some cheese on top. This recipe is a good base for other breakfast casseroles. May try a different meat next time.
This is the my second Christmas making this dish.

I spent Christmas Eve day prepping everything for Christmas Day. This took time to chop the onions and cook the bacon but once that was done everything went quickly. Christmas morning I put it in the oven and in an hour I was having breakfast. I thought it was so good that I had 3 helpings. Will do it again. It's definitely a 5 stars in my recipe file.
I liked this a lot, although, I would brown the hash browns a bit first.
Great recipe. It’s a Christmas staple in our home.

The family loved it! It was nice to be able to prep it the night before and just pop it into the oven in the morning as well. I took advice from some of the other commenters and put in 6 eggs instead of 4. I also added a chopped green bell pepper to the recipe. As I don't like to get the top too brown, I turned the oven down to 350 and baked it for an hour and a half, and for me, that was perfect. This recipe is a keeper!
I addedgreen peppers to the onions and breakfast sausage to the bacon. Yum

I used the recommendation of others and used 8 eggs, used southern style hashbrowns which already has spicey ingredients, and added the cheese after the egg bake was cooked for 30 minutes and cooked it for another 25-30 minutes with the cheese. I also made it again the following weekend for my family and friends and everyone absolutely loved it. It'll be my go-to dish for brunch get-togethers! Thank you.

This gets rave reviews but I have added my own touches - added fresh spinach - did ground breakfast sausage instead of bacon - for a larger crowd added a few more eggs and extra milk - lots of cheese on top!
Since the bacon has salt, I would omit adding salt. I found it a little too salty. Other than that, was great!

Pretty good recipe- with some adjustments. After reading lots of reviews, what needed to be seasoned is the potatoes. Mixed some of the bacon and cheese and onion/garlic/mushrooms along with seasonings (cooked in bacon fat) in with potatoes before "layering". I did use 8 eggs instead of 4. Oh, I added a little (4Tbsp) sour cream into eggs/milk before pouring over potatoes. Update: forgot to include, baked covered 45 minutes/ uncovered 15 minutes. (Had already sliced into it :-p)
Great recipe. Easy to make. One caution though is to watch the cooking time. I cooked it fresh for 45 minutes and that was too long. I will be making this again.
Definitely make again!
Everyone loved it. However I used 10 eggs, baked it covered at 375 for 45 minutes, uncovered for 15.
It was okay. Next time I will make it with more eggs & less bacon to suit my family preference. Overall, a good recipe.
See my review above. Here's the after shot: the side with no cheese was a request by someone who's lactose intolerant.
Only thing I didn't use was Hashbrowns.

I agree that this is a good basic recipe but you can take this in any direction. I am Italian so for flavor I added fresh garlic, dry oregano and parsley to the mushrooms. Doubled the eggs and added Romano cheese. I have also done this like a Taco bake with cilantro, chili peppers and fresh chopped salsa topped with manchego cheese. Just be creative. Add what you like!
I will definitely make this breakfast casserole again for our Christmas Brunch. I added 4 more eggs and substituted 12 oz carton of cottage cheese for the milk. Our guests loved it.
I didn't add mushrooms. It was great!

I made this during Easter week when I had family guests for the week. Christmas guests asked for a repeat. It was delicious just the way the recipes calls. This will be my new go to recipe when I need a big breakfast for lots of people with little time spent cooking. I also adjust the servings when it’s just me.
I will be making this for our VFW breakfast and will let you know how it turns out. With your recipes, I wish you would add "Suggested Servings".
Great recipe! Easy to make. Added kale. Would omit one onion next time.
It was wonderful and I followed the recipe. My husband thought there were too many onions, but no complaints from anyone else.

Was easy and worked great for a do ahead breakfast. I basically doubled the egg and milk mixture as it barely covered half the dish. I added the extra just before baking as it seemed like even more of the liquid was absorbed over night. Came out well and would definitely recommend. Family all enjoyed.
Next time I will make a half recipe so I don’t have so much left over.
I used this as a base ingredient list and procedure. What I changed is I used O'Brien frozen potatoes and also a little less onion and more mushroom, also forgot the milk but it turned out great.

I have made this before but not for a while. Before I made it this time for Christmas day I read the reviews and made some additions. I may have used a little bit more hashbrowns than what it calls for and I used bacon. A lot of bacon! Probably 2lbs thick-sliced in bite size pieces. I also mixed the seasonings with the eggs and milk before I added them over the hashbrowns and bacon. And I added a ton of cheese probably at least 3 cups if not a little more. I used 1/3 mild cheddar and 2/3 sharp cheese. And I didn’t add the cheese until about 5-10 minutes before it was supposed to be finished. That seem to be perfect. Everyone loved it and raved on and on about it. I will definitely make this again

Family really loved it. The only thing I will do differently next time is really watch the last 15 minutes and reduce the cooking time. It could be my oven, but an hour at 400 degrees almost burned the top of the casserole.
This was a really nice brunch casserole; great hit with the family.
No, dry and tasteless. Don’t waste your time.
made for Christmas 2019 and girls loved it. would bake a little longer next time.
I thought this was great. I did use 6 eggs and stirred it all together instead of layering. I also doubled the cheese.

Pretty much followed the recipe. I used a 8x8 pan, so reduced the quantities a bit (3 eggs vice 4). I sauteed some green peppers with the onions and, with the bacon, browned and crumbled some spicy breakfast sausage. Everything turned out great.

Easy, yummy, flexible recipe. I roughly doubled everything in this recipe except the bacon. I used 12 eggs, two 8 oz packages of diced ham (no bacon), 2.25 c skim milk, one 32 oz bag of diced potatoes, one 2 c bag of shredded sharp cheddar, some garlic & I accidentally threw 2 T of butter into the mix instead of using it to grease my pan. I thought for sure it would stick without it, but it didn't at all. I used a 9x13 glass pan & these ingredients fit perfectly - if I had added much else I would have needed a second pan. I mixed it all together in a bowl before pouring into pan & refrigerated about 24 hours before cooking. I cooked it for 45 min at 400 degrees & it was done. I left it in on warm for 15 more minutes because it wasn't time to eat yet. I didn't add any veggies due to picky eaters, & although I didn't find it bland, I thought it could use a small amount of onion & green pepper. I think this recipe would work well a variety of ways.
It was way too oniony and i only used one onion.
Will make again for sure!!

I tried crisping the hash browns on the stovetop prior to pouring into casserole dish. Then added bacon, egg mixture and cheese. I did not refrigerate after prepping, just did everything at once. I was concerned the cheese would burn prior to the eggs cooking but it was ok. My son requested mozzarella next time instead of cheddar. I omitted the onion and mushroom but my hash mix did already have onions and peppers. I may try covering with foil next time until the last few minutes.

Boring, not tasty, and nothing to recommend it. Only gave 2stars because the recipe did actually work and made an edible casserole. I don’t understand why so many people loved this recipe. Potatoes made it very bland, feel like if I ever made it again (won’t), I’d stir it all up before cooking and I’d add something tastier, like sour cream or cream cheese or feta, or all that... would also double the meat and use/add breakfast sausage (for more flavor).

I made this casserole with a few modifications. I used turkey bacon, sautéed onions, 1 1/2 cups milk, 2 cups of cheese and 4 eggs. Instead of using frozen hash browns, I made my own which I seasoned which I’m thinking saved this otherwise bland dish. I wish I had read the reviews before making it per the directions. My chief complaint is the cheese was burned. I think it would’ve made more sense to bake at 350 instead of 400 and for less than an hour if prepared and refrigerated over night. Also adding more eggs to the recipe would’ve made it feel less like a potato casserole. Overall the flavor was great and I definitely will be making this again however with more eggs and maybe adding the cheese in later to prevent the hard crusty feel it has. Thanks for sharing!
Very tasty
I substituted sausage for bacon. It turned out GREAT!

I will be serving this at church this morning and another one Christmas morning. Since there will be many kids around, I left out the mushrooms and onions. It's in the oven now. Can't wait to see how it is received! Merry Christmas!
It came out pretty good...The time on the baking needs to be changed so next time I will do it for 45 min at 375 and keep checking it....very good and family loved it.

I basically triple the recipe and use about a dozen eggs. I use frozen tator tots but I cook them first in the oven then throw the other ingredients on top (well mix together). I find this way the potatoes have a bit of texture instead of just getting mush. I also add some cooked Jimmy dean hot sausage and a mild sausage (we like meat). I also add cilantro and green onion. I also add some more seasonings such as chili powder garlic powder onion powder, paprika, and sometimes a smidge of cumin. I bake in a huge foil disposable container for 350 for almost 45 or until the egg is all set. I bake it covered for about 30 min then uncovered the last 10-15 to let the cheese brown up. I also use a blend of Mexican cheeses.
Excellent!
Delicious and SO easy! It was an instant hit!
Made it for a brunch event at work and it got rave reviews!
This was very good. Add peppers, chriszo sausage or other spicy meats and/or ham, italian sweet sausage. Did not use mushrooms.
I didn't have my 9x13 pan so I split the ingredients into 2 pie pans. I added spinach & herb seasoning to one of them. I baked it 20 min then added the cheese and only had to bake another 5-10 min.

I made this recipe for Christmas morning. The only complaint was that there was not enough for seconds. So I made it again on New Years Day and doubled it. I can't wait to make it again next Christmas.
This was easy and quick to make,I did it the night before and we ate it on Christmas but for lunch
Similar to other reviews I would double the eggs and half the potatoes to make it taste more eggy. I made it the way the recipe states and it was more of a potato dish with a topping.
Very good -- my husband loved it!
My family loved this Christmas morning. I forgot to but frozen hash browns, so I made fresh ones using my food processor. No one knew the difference!
My family loved this Christmas morning. I forgot to but frozen hash browns, so I made fresh ones using my food processor. No one knew the difference!
We like spicy food so I added 505 green chili sauce and decreased the milk; everyone went back for more. Will prepare this again next year.
No followed directions it was very moist and delicious will make it again

good blank slate of a recipe. I would assume it would be bland if done as is. I added more veggies and did sausage and bacon and it was still potato heavy. I realized after that adding the cheese INSIDE the dish would have made it cheesier and more flavorful
I Made it with 1/3 the onion it called for and it was perfect! Also found a Kraft 3 cheddar shred with cream cheese. highly recommended.

I prepared this Christmas Eve and popped it in the oven Christmas morning. The entire family loved it- which makes it a bit of a Christmas miracle. I like heavily seasoned food so I just added more of the spices but that's just personal preference. I think next time, and there will be many next times, I will sautee garlic with the onions and mushrooms. 

The casserole didn't last the day, but it did reheat well and I added a dollop of sour cream to my second helping and enjoyed that as well. I also think the recipe is very forgiving and would be a great canvas for anything you might wish to add to it. I am very grateful I found this recipe. It's a keeper.

We will definitely make this again! When I was making this, I was afraid it might be too salty. It was not at all! Using a 9 x 13 pan, I baked it UNCOVERED for 40 minutes, let it sit for 10 
minutes, and was very happy with the results! I think using ham would be a good substitute, if desired. Thank you for posting this!

Delicious! We used to have breakfast casserole every Christmas morning however I didn't have the recipe my grandma used. This was amazing and I highly recommend it. Now I did mix everything together instead of layering and I left out the mushrooms. Still stayed close to the original.
I really liked the idea of preparing the night before. I made as is but exchanged seasoning salt for the salts listed and added extra pepper at the table. Fantastic!
I made half the recipe and it turned out nicely. Next time I think i’ll Add some red bell pepper for color and flavor. Easy to add different flavors to make it your way!
I followed the recipe exactly. Very tasty.

This casserole was for New Years, since I was staying with family, I thought I bring it for brunch or a snack. My son-in-law said it was really good. He ate it for breakfast on the first day, and then heated it up in a skillet on day 2, which was even better. 

If I make it again, I will use sharp cheddar cheese and maybe less milk, because I found it a bit bland myself.
Not as pretty as some breakfast casseroles but very tasty. Your choice of sausage meat will be a key to success in flavouring.
Next time I will make it with 12 eggs and 3 cups of sharpe cheddar cheese. Then cook it at 400 for 30mins covered and 30mins uncovered. Awesome recipe!

For the sake of the mushroom-haters in my family, I only put them in half the casserole. Followed the rest of the instructions. Everyone loved it, though I did think it was too greasy. Next time I would drain much of the bacon grease before sauteing.

I used 12 fresh eggs from our farm so there would be enough for 8 people. I only used about 1/2 a cup of milk because 1 1/2 just seemed like too much. I also sauteed the rest of the hash browns in the bag and put them on top so that it looked more appetizing. Everyone loved it!

Add a small garden salad & you've got a nice meal. I prefer to make 2 ar a time so I freeze one. It's not twice the work but I have 2 meals. I only added more onions as I love them, but otherwise prepared it as directed.
This was good overall, but a bit too eggy for my taste and a bit too greasy for my husband's taste.

My family loved this casserole! I disagree with any of the comments that said it was bland. Cooking the onions and mushrooms in the bacon grease added just the right amount of savory to the entire dish. I also thoroughly salted and peppered the hashbrowns on the bottom before adding anything else. I also didn't measure out the mushrooms or cheese, but used an entire 16 oz. carton of sliced fresh mushrooms and an entire 2 pound bag of shredded sharp cheddar. I do agree that the bottom is a little mushy while the cheese on top was a little overly done. Next time, I'll cook it a little longer and wait to add the cheese in the last 15 minutes of cooktime. It was absolutely delicious, though, and so super easy to prepare. Loved only having to pop it in the oven on Christmas morning.
Good breakfast casserole. Added peppers and 2 extra eggs, plus added chez at the end of baking.

Great recipe with a little tweeking. I added a red bell pepper and used 8 eggs and I had left over ham, so I used that instead. I made it the night before and added the cheese 20 minutes before it was done. It smelled wonderful and my family raved about it. They topped it with a dot of sour cream and hot sauce. Absolutely delicious! I'll make this again.

So I chose this recipe because my daughter has a gluten intolerance and this is actually gluten free... Don't be fooled by my rating. This is a great recipe and very delicious but it needs lots of adjustments. Instead of bacon I used ground sausage (we just like it more). There wasn't much egg to it, so next time I will use 6 instead of 4. I also added a diced green bell pepper and about 4 green onions sliced and sprinkled just beneath the cheese. A cup of cheese wasn't quite enough either so I would make it about 1 1/2 cups instead next time. Everything else about this recipe is great. Everyone loved it and I will definitely make this again with the adjustments.

Made this for Christmas Eve morning, the day after my son's wedding and the brunch we were having with his new in-laws. It was great!! Everybody loved it and while I have made similar casseroles before, I think having this sit in the fridge for two days (had to make it so early because of the lack of time with the rehearsal dinner and the wedding and all) really improved the taste.
Tasted pretty good. Got a little crispy leaving it in for the alloted time. Found it easier just to mix everything together and bake it.

It is very bland...not bad with salsa. It definitely needs added ingredients to give it some flavor. I will be adding a lot of onion, bell pepper and red pepper the next time I make it. Salsa saved the day on this first round!
Can this be made with soy milk?

Love it! I made this for a girl's brunch and everyone had polished plates afterwards. Hubby had some afterwards and he loved it too. Just a couple of minor tweaks. Cooking the onions and mushrooms is going to take MUCH longer than 5 minutes to cook down. Instead of garlic salt, I used 2 large cloves of minced fresh garlic and added it along with the onions and mushrooms towards the last few minutes of cooking in the frying pan. In addition to parsley, I also added some thyme which added a lot of great flavor. I think the next time I make this recipe I will also try adding a bit of cayenne just to give it a little zip.

Great recipe! I used 1-1/2 lb. sweet Italian pork sausage, brown and drain well, instead of the bacon. also added 1 large minced garlic clove to the onion and mushroom mix. I'll definitely make again!
This has become a Christmas morning staple in our house!
A friend brought this to a potluck and I loved it so we made it for Christmas morning breakfast when family was in town and it was a hit.
I followed the recipe step by step and there were ZERO left overs!
this recipe was very bland and not very interesting
This is a great recipe. I didn't have any hash browns so I grated some potatoes instead. I doubled the eggs and it turned out good. I think I'll add more veggies next time I make it.
Definitely add green peppers. I also added jalapeños and sausage for extra flavor and only added cheese at the last 25 minutes. Delicious!!!
I added jalapenos and an extra egg. Turned out great!
I made per instructions. It tasted strange and bland. I really did not like it. The hash browns were mushy and should have had far more seasoning.

I followed the direction of a few others, and added more egg, using 10, skipped the mushrooms as no one in my household likes them, and cut the onion down to one. I didn't have hashbrowns, so I shredded five medium potatoes. This came out awesome. As others have said, its a great base recipe that allows you to mix and match ingredients. Simple prep, and the fact you don't have to cook in the morning is great. 
I also cooked at 350 for 1 hr covered and 30 minutes uncovered.
This was surprisingly bland. As many have said it does not have enough eggs but it was just blah...won't make again.

I was a bit disappointed with this recipe. I decided to make it for breakfast today, without letting it stand in the fridge overnight. I am not sure what frozen hash brown potatoes are (already cooked e.g.?), so I just used raw, shredded potatoes. Like some reviewers did, I mixed all the ingredients together before pouring the egg over. I did add some cheese on top. Perhaps next time I'd like to first fry the shredded potatoes slightly, and then top it with the filling and egg. It could be quite nice if it had some sort of crust at the bottom. The way I made it today, does not really appeal to us. After breakfast, my husband remarked that he still preferred bacon and eggs and trimmings - I always ask for honest opinions. Not sure if I will try it again.
Husband prefers his regular bacon and egg breakfast, kids didnt like it either. It is worth a try, just not to our tastes.
